page.title: 17PETS
page.content: The children at school have lots of {pets_ponies,dogs,cats,rabbits,budgies, {hamsters,guinea-pigs and gold-fish. There are always dogs and cats on the farms.June's pony, Snowy, is 12 hands high.One day she caught her in the field with a handful of pony-nuts.She groomed her with a dandy-brush and a curry-comb to get all the loose hair and dust out of her coat.She put a rug and then the saddle on her back and the bridle over her head.After a ride in the woods, enjoying bluebells and other wild flowers, June groomed Snowy again and put her in her stable.June also lets other children ride Snowy at events organised by the School Parents Organisation.At one such event, an Exemption Dog Show, Kirsty won a prize for the dog with the waggiest tail. Richard's dog won a prize at Crufts.
